content: Is there a JSON version of the patient-example.xml file and other resource files used for the FHIRPath tests (which @Bryn Rhodes showed me are at https://github.com/FHIR/fluentpath/tree/master/spec/test.zip)? If not, is it possible to easily convert that XML into JSON without knowledge of the FHIR resources? If not, is there a conversion tool available for converting an XML resource into JSON?
No it's no possible - we can use some online converters to do it once
all those resources are just copies of the resources from the build. so you grab the json versions of those files from the appropriate build
You can also just post them to a server and then get them in JSON format, that's what I do when I need to convert between formats.
@Grahame Grieve By "the build" do you mean https://github.com/HL7/fhir? I found ./source/patient/patient-example.xml there, but not the JSON and didn't see a way to select a release.
I think Grahame is referring to the published specification: http://hl7.org/fhir/patient-example.json.html
